question: The "Dyrehaven Forest Park" is located in which country?
explanation: Dyrehaven Forest Park or the Deer Park, also known as Jaegersborg Dyrehave, is located in Copenhagen, Denmark. It houses huge, ancient oak trees and large populations of red and fallow deer. In 2015, it was one of the three forests included in the UNESCO World Heritage Site inscribed as "Par force hunting landscape in North Zealand". It hosts several annual events such as Eremitage Race, Day of the Kite and Hubertus Hunt, a cross country horse race.
